result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert H Lyons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert H Lyons is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert H Lyons was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $500.00 plus all costs, assessments and surcharges.  To be taken from bail on deposit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert H Lyons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC, Criminal Complaint, and Court Record sent to Valeria Taylor, Attorney at Law (State Public Defender - 819 N 6th St.).
State Subpoena
State Subpoena
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 10/14/14. LJ
File back to Br. 38 re: costs.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Howard Barry Mitz.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter has resolved short of trial.
AS to count 2, Battery:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered an entry of judgment of conviction.
Upon motion of state, counts 1 and 3 ordered DISMISSED.
State has contacted the victim and is prepared to proceed to sentencing today.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 23 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 23 days time served.  
The Court orders a fine of $500.00 plus all costs, assessements and surcharges to be taken from BAIL ON DEPOSIT.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Howard Barry Mitz.  Kevin R. Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is currently set for jury trial on 8-18-2014.  Investigating officer is not available for trial date.  The State is able to proceed without officer in its case, however, the defense is not.  The Court will grant adjournment of jury trial.  Case set for final pretrial on 10-2-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 10-20-2014 at 8:15am.

Received from the State: List of Witnesses and Proposed Jury Instructions
Received from defense:  Motions in Limine and attached Order
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Howard Barry Mitz.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for Miriam Falk for the State of Wisconsin.
All discovery has been provided to counsel.  Negotiations are continuing.  The Court will set another final pretrial on 8-5-2014.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Howard B Mitz.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty John Krejci moves to withdraw as Atty Mitz has been retained.
Case set for final pretrial on 7-9-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 8-18-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions/witness lists to be filed by 5-23-2014.  Any evidentiary matters to be heard on final pretrial date.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

14RM021050  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-19-14
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney John M Krejci.  Defendant Robert H Lyons in custody.  Jennifer Williams for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VSM, HER RESIDENCE OR HER EMPLOYMENT.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Robert H Lyons in court with attorney Mary P. Polenz.  Defendant Robert H Lyons in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
